description:
When the U.S. launched its invasion of Afghanistan and Iraq in the early 2000s, it had been a decade since a full-scale deployment of American troops.

That's why when the wars started a lot of the medical corps' experience came from big city emergency rooms.

But a few years into the wars, the military was facing hundreds of casualties each month between Afghanistan and Iraq.

Military surgeons were seeing wounds requiring double amputations, the kind of thing you might never encounter before serving in a war zone.

The military was able to turn that real world experience into breakthroughs in battlefield care. Some of them were simple tweaks like pop up surgical teams that set up close to the battlefield.

Over the course of the war, small innovations like this tripled the survival rate for the most critically injured troops, according to one study

Now that the post 9/11 wars have ended, some veteran military doctors
title: Battlefield medicine has come a long way. But that progress could be lost

description: The image, with about 50 million shares, is considered the most viral ever AI-generated photo. Tracing the image’s history has revealed a rift over its true creator.
title: ‘All eyes on Rafah’ is the Internet's most viral AI meme. 2 artists are claiming credit.

description: The mystery: How did bubonic plague spread so rapidly? Could rat fleas have done it all? A new study points the finger at lice as possible accomplices.
title: Don't just blame rat fleas. Lice may have helped spread 'black death' plague

description: Mexico makes history with its first female president. How an extra $30 a month kept a cancer patient from qualifying for Medicaid.
title: Mexico's first female president; a Georgia cancer patient's Medicaid struggle

description: If you dread getting on a scale to calculate your body mass index, there’s a good reason to ignore the measure. Body composition tests are an increasingly popular way to gauge health. Here’s why they're better than BMI.
title: Step aside BMI, body composition tests are on the rise. Here's what to know

description: Meza Malonga, a restaurant in Rwanda's capital Kigali, serves innovative Afro-fusion cuisine. Chef Dieuveil Malonga opened it in 2020, after years of working in high-end European restaurants.
title: This chef in Rwanda wants to create a revolution in African cuisine

description: Opponents have denounced the legislation as "the Russian law" because it resembles measures pushed through by the Kremlin to crack down on independent news media, nonprofits and activists.
title: Georgia's parliament speaker signs divisive foreign influence bill into law

description: South Korea’s presidential national security council said it has decided to suspend a 2018 inter-Korean agreement aimed at easing animosities, until mutual trust between the two Koreas is restored.
title: South Korea says it will suspend peace deal with North Korea over balloon launches

description: Skye Blakely and Kayla DiCello placed silver and bronze in all-around, respectively.
title: Simone Biles has won her 9th all-around national championship
